20101222141128.000|20101222141131.000|TR0|Conduct."  Anyway, he says this book is

20101222141829.000|20101222141831.000|TR0|
20101222141831.000|20101222141834.000|TR0|Sixty-six years ago in the dense, 
20101222141834.000|20101222141836.000|TR0|snow-covered forests of Western Europe, 
20101222141836.000|20101222141839.000|TR0|allied forces were beating back a massive 
20101222141839.000|20101222141842.000|TR0|assault in what would become known as the 
20101222141842.000|20101222141844.000|TR0|Battle of the Bulge.  And in the final 
20101222141844.000|20101222141847.000|TR0|days of the fighting, a regiment in the 
20101222141847.000|20101222141849.000|TR0|80th Division of Patton's 3rd Army came 
20101222141849.000|20101222141852.000|TR0|under fire.
20101222141852.000|20101222141854.000|TR0|
20101222141854.000|20101222141857.000|TR0|The men were traveling along a narrow 
20101222141857.000|20101222141900.000|TR0|trail.  They were exposed, and they were 
20101222141900.000|20101222141902.000|TR0|vulnerable.  Hundreds of soldiers were cut 
20101222141902.000|20101222141905.000|TR0|down by the enemy.  And during the 
20101222141905.000|20101222141907.000|TR0|firefight, a private named Lloyd Corwin 
20101222141907.000|20101222141910.000|TR0|tumbled 40 feet down the deep side of a 
20101222141910.000|20101222141913.000|TR0|ravine.  And dazed and trapped, he was as 
20101222141913.000|20101222141915.000|TR0|good as dead.
20101222141915.000|20101222141918.000|TR0|
20101222141918.000|20101222141920.000|TR0|But one soldier, a friend, turned back.  
20101222141920.000|20101222141923.000|TR0|With shells landing around him, amid smoke 
20101222141923.000|20101222141925.000|TR0|and chaos and the screams of wounded men, 
20101222141925.000|20101222141928.000|TR0|this soldier, this friend, scaled down the 
20101222141928.000|20101222141931.000|TR0|icy slope, risking his own life, to bring 
20101222141931.000|20101222141933.000|TR0|Private Corwin to safer ground.       For 
20101222141933.000|20101222141936.000|TR0|the rest of his years, Lloyd credited this 
20101222141936.000|20101222141938.000|TR0|soldier, this friend, named Andy Lee, with 
20101222141938.000|20101222141941.000|TR0|saving his life, knowing he would never 
20101222141941.000|20101222141944.000|TR0|have made it out alone.  It was a full 
20101222141944.000|20101222141946.000|TR0|four decades after the war, when the two 
20101222141946.000|20101222141949.000|TR0|friends reunited in their golden years, 
20101222141949.000|20101222141951.000|TR0|that Lloyd learned that the man who saved 
20101222141951.000|20101222141954.000|TR0|his life, his friend Andy, was gay.  He 
20101222141954.000|20101222141956.000|TR0|had no idea.  And he didn't much care.
20101222141956.000|20101222141959.000|TR0|
20101222141959.000|20101222142002.000|TR0|Lloyd knew what mattered.  He knew what 
20101222142002.000|20101222142004.000|TR0|had kept him alive, what made it possible 
20101222142004.000|20101222142007.000|TR0|for him to come home and start a family, 
20101222142007.000|20101222142009.000|TR0|and live the rest of his life.  It was his 
20101222142009.000|20101222142012.000|TR0|friend.  And Lloyd's son is with us today. 
20101222142012.000|20101222142014.000|TR0| And he knew that valor and sacrifice are 
20101222142014.000|20101222142017.000|TR0|no more limited by sexual orientation than 
20101222142017.000|20101222142020.000|TR0|they are by race, or by gender, or by 
20101222142020.000|20101222142022.000|TR0|religion, or by creed.  That what made it 
20101222142022.000|20101222142025.000|TR0|possible for him to survive the 
20101222142025.000|20101222142027.000|TR0|battlefields of Europe is the reason that 
20101222142027.000|20101222142030.000|TR0|we are here today.

20101222142942.000|20101222142945.000|TR0|Mullen, as well as the vast majority of

20101222142947.000|20101222142950.000|TR0|view.  And they share it based on their 
20101222142950.000|20101222142953.000|TR0|own experiences, including the experience 
20101222142953.000|20101222142955.000|TR0|of serving with dedicate dedicated, 
20101222142955.000|20101222142958.000|TR0|duty-bound service members who were also 
20101222142958.000|20101222143000.000|TR0|gay.
20101222143000.000|20101222143003.000|TR0|
20101222143003.000|20101222143006.000|TR0|As one special operations war fighter said 
20101222143006.000|20101222143008.000|TR0|during the Pentagon's review -- this was 
20101222143008.000|20101222143011.000|TR0|one of my favorites.  It echoes the 
20101222143011.000|20101222143013.000|TR0|experience of Lloyd Corwin decades 
20101222143013.000|20101222143016.000|TR0|earlier.  "We have a gay guy in the unit.  
20101222143016.000|20101222143018.000|TR0|He's big.  He's mean.  He kills lots of 
20101222143018.000|20101222143021.000|TR0|bad guys."
20101222143021.000|20101222143024.000|TR0|
20101222143024.000|20101222143026.000|TR0|(LAUGHTER)
20101222143026.000|20101222143029.000|TR0|
20101222143029.000|20101222143031.000|TR0|OBAMA:  "No one cared that he was gay."
20101222143031.000|20101222143034.000|TR0|
20101222143034.000|20101222143037.000|TR0|(LAUGHTER)
20101222143037.000|20101222143039.000|TR0|
20101222143039.000|20101222143042.000|TR0|OBAMA:  And I think that sums up perfectly 
20101222143042.000|20101222143044.000|TR0|the situation.
20101222143044.000|20101222143047.000|TR0|
20101222143047.000|20101222143049.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101222143049.000|20101222143052.000|TR0|
20101222143052.000|20101222143055.000|TR0|OBAMA:  So, finally, I want to speak 
20101222143055.000|20101222143057.000|TR0|directly to the gay men and women 
20101222143057.000|20101222143100.000|TR0|currently serving in our military.  For a 
20101222143100.000|20101222143102.000|TR0|long time, your service has demanded a 
20101222143102.000|20101222143105.000|TR0|particular kind of sacrifice.  You've been 
20101222143105.000|20101222143108.000|TR0|asked to carry the added burden of secrecy 
20101222143108.000|20101222143110.000|TR0|and isolation, and all the while, you've 
20101222143110.000|20101222143113.000|TR0|put your lives on the line for the 
20101222143113.000|20101222143115.000|TR0|freedoms and privileges of citizenship 
20101222143115.000|20101222143118.000|TR0|that are not fully granted to you.
20101222143118.000|20101222143120.000|TR0|
20101222143120.000|20101222143123.000|TR0|You're not the first to have carried this 
20101222143123.000|20101222143126.000|TR0|burden.  For, while today marks the end of 
20101222143126.000|20101222143128.000|TR0|a particular struggle that has lasted 
20101222143128.000|20101222143131.000|TR0|almost two decades, this is a moment more 
20101222143131.000|20101222143133.000|TR0|than two centuries in the making.
20101222143133.000|20101222143136.000|TR0|
20101222143136.000|20101222143138.000|TR0|There will never be a full accounting of 
20101222143138.000|20101222143141.000|TR0|the heroism of gay Americans in service to 
20101222143141.000|20101222143144.000|TR0|this country.  Their service has been 
20101222143144.000|20101222143146.000|TR0|obscured in history, it's been lost to 
20101222143146.000|20101222143149.000|TR0|prejudices that have waned in our own 
20101222143149.000|20101222143151.000|TR0|lifetimes.  But at every turn, at every 
20101222143151.000|20101222143154.000|TR0|crossroads in our past, we know gay 
20101222143154.000|20101222143157.000|TR0|Americans fought just as hard, gave just 
20101222143157.000|20101222143159.000|TR0|as much, to protect this nation and the 
20101222143159.000|20101222143202.000|TR0|ideals for which it stands.
20101222143202.000|20101222143204.000|TR0|
20101222143204.000|20101222143207.000|TR0|There can be little doubt, there were gay 
20101222143207.000|20101222143209.000|TR0|soldiers who fought for American 
20101222143209.000|20101222143212.000|TR0|independence, who consecrated the ground 
20101222143212.000|20101222143215.000|TR0|at Gettysburg, who manned the trenches 
20101222143215.000|20101222143217.000|TR0|along the western front, who stormed the 
20101222143217.000|20101222143220.000|TR0|beaches of Iwo Jima.  Their names are 
20101222143220.000|20101222143222.000|TR0|etched into the walls of our memorials. 
20101222143222.000|20101222143225.000|TR0|There headstones dot the grounds at 
20101222143225.000|20101222143228.000|TR0|Arlington.
20101222143228.000|20101222143230.000|TR0|
20101222143230.000|20101222143233.000|TR0|And so as the first generation to serve 
20101222143233.000|20101222143235.000|TR0|openly in our armed forces you will stand 
20101222143235.000|20101222143238.000|TR0|for all those who came before you, and you 
20101222143238.000|20101222143240.000|TR0|will serve as role models to all who come 
20101222143240.000|20101222143243.000|TR0|after.
20101222143243.000|20101222143246.000|TR0|
20101222143246.000|20101222143248.000|TR0|And I know that you will fulfill this 
20101222143248.000|20101222143251.000|TR0|responsibility with integrity and honor, 
20101222143251.000|20101222143253.000|TR0|just as you have every other mission with 
20101222143253.000|20101222143256.000|TR0|which you've been charged.
20101222143256.000|20101222143259.000|TR0|

20101222143434.000|20101222143437.000|TR0|importance of enlisting the service of all 
20101222143437.000|20101222143439.000|TR0|who are willing to fight for this country.

20101222143455.000|20101222143457.000|TR0|
20101222143457.000|20101222143500.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)          OBAMA:  That is why I 
20101222143500.000|20101222143502.000|TR0|say to all Americans, gay or straight, who 
20101222143502.000|20101222143505.000|TR0|want nothing more than to defend this 
20101222143505.000|20101222143508.000|TR0|country in uniform, your country needs 
20101222143508.000|20101222143510.000|TR0|you, your country wants you, and we will 
20101222143510.000|20101222143513.000|TR0|be honored to welcome you into the ranks 
20101222143513.000|20101222143515.000|TR0|of the finest military the world has ever 
20101222143515.000|20101222143518.000|TR0|known.
20101222143518.000|20101222143520.000|TR0|
20101222143520.000|20101222143523.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)

20101222144757.000|20101222144759.000|TR0|Peninsula have contemplated an
